comments.body:
```suggestion
First retrieve all inputs using `object.getValues()`, and then perform the computation.

There are two ways to perform a computation:
- Perform it directly in the function. This is the simplest solution, and results in ~3x speed up.
- Offload the computation into the RooBatchCompute library. In addition to the 3x speed up due to better data access, additional speed up due to vectorisation can be used. 
```c++
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +17,21 @@The normSet (normalization set) is used for invoking the computation and retrieving the values of the variables of the PDF.
You don't need to worry about these arguments as they will be provided by the RooFit internal functions that will call `evaluateSpan()`.
```c++
RooSpan<double> RooMyPDF::evaluateSpan(RooBatchCompute::RunContext& evalData, const RooArgSet* normSet) const
{
